common_issues.title: Pieces OS Connection Errors

Potential solutions include verifying Pieces OS is running and checking firewall settings.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

hi i have been using it for 2 days but for the last 2 hours the desktop and visual studio extension are not working. 

No matter what I type, it gives me this error. There was an update message for the app, it was about installing a version, I installed it but it didn't fix it.
always the same message 
visual studio ide 2022 17.12 
windows 10 pro
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c64d85bd-eb1a-4f1c-a25e-570c9a55ccd1)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/55b600a6-95f4-4e71-aee1-1b1ce8b6599c)


## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points:**
* Users are encountering an error message "Something went wrong with processing" when using Claude and Gemini models.
* This issue appears to be related to an outdated OpenAI API key or local SSL certificates.

**Workarounds/Solutions Proposed:**
* Remove the OpenAI API key and rely on Pieces' built-in models.
* Switch to the GPT4o model instead of Claude or Gemini.
* Update Pieces to version 11.0.3 and ensure you're signed in.
* Try debugging in real-time with the developer.
* Reinstall the Pieces applications and ensure Windows Defender isn't blocking requests.

**Outcome:**
* The exact cause of the error remains unidentified, though solutions like removing the OpenAI API key have been successful for some users.
* Users experiencing the error are encouraged to try the proposed workarounds or reach out to the developer for further assistance.

common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop Application UI and Functionality Issues
common_issues.description: Users report various issues with the Pieces desktop app, including large font sizes impacting readability, inability to zoom on certain screens, and Copilot functionality problems. Proposed solutions include UI adjustments, hotkeys for zooming, and software updates. Some issues persist, requiring further investigation and debugging.

related_issues.title: The interface's font is too large.
related_issues.text:
The interface's font is too large.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

The recent interface update, specifically the increased font size in the answer section, limits the number of answers that can be displayed. 
![Screenshot from 2024-07-12 22-14-57](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3265af50-ffc6-4ab1-b6b8-397cd3979a9f)

## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key points raised:**

* **UI Adjustments:** User @ksubramanyeshwara requested UI adjustments for the Pieces Copilot app, particularly font size issues.
* **Pieces Services Down:** @shivaypiece acknowledged that some Pieces services were down and assured users that the team was working on a fix.
* **Font Size and Zoom Issues:** Several users reported font size issues after an update. Users also highlighted the inability to zoom in/out on onboarding screens. 
* **Accessibility and Consistency:** @choir241 emphasized the need for zoom functionalities in onboarding screens for accessibility and consistency purposes.

**Problems identified:**

* Font size increased after an update.
* Unable to zoom in/out on onboarding screens.
* Difficulty zooming in chat window on certain platforms.
* Large fonts on high-resolution screens. 

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* The team promised UI adjustments for the Pieces Copilot app.
* Users were advised to use "Ctrl+" or "Ctrl-" keys to zoom in/out the desktop application.
* Version 3.1.0 of the Desktop App was released, which might address some of the issues.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue seems partially resolved with the release of version 3.1.0.
* However, some users continue to experience problems with zooming in chat windows and large font sizes on high-resolution screens. 

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation mentions a user named @mack-at-pieces who appears to be a Pieces team member.
* Several screenshots were provided to illustrate the issues.

common_issues.title: Pieces installation and functionality issues
common_issues.description: Users report various issues with Pieces installation and functionality across different operating systems, including Ollama installation failures on Linux, app installer issues on Windows due to Defender blockage, and Copilot functionality problems on MacOS. Solutions involve addressing sandbox limitations, Windows Defender compatibility, and debugging Copilot integration.

related_issues.title: Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
related_issues.text:
Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

User reports immediate "Ollama failed to install" diaglog upon clicking install Ollama install button in Pieces desktop app
## Issue Summary: Pieces app fails to install Ollama

- Key points:
    - Using the Pieces app in a snap environment on Ubuntu.
    - The app tries to install Ollama but fails with "Ollama failed to install".
    - The issue is not with the user's system missing `curl`, but with `curl` not being available within the snap environment's sandbox.

- Problems identified:
    - Pieces package attempting to use `curl` within the snap sandbox, where it's not available.
    - Attempting to install Ollama globally has no effect due to the sandbox limitations.

- Solutions proposed/implemented:
    - Add `curl` to the list of dependency packages in the snap definition file.
    - Develop a patch that allows accessing Ollama from within the sandbox.

- Current status/outcome:
    - Fix is still in development.
    - Issue remains in the latest snap version as of 2025-01-23.
    - Expected fix in the following week (around 2025-01-30).

all failed
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* User reports issues installing the Pieces app on Windows:
    * AppInstaller method doesn't work.
    * Downloaded EXE installs but doesn't start.
* User discovers Windows Defender is blocking the app.
* After adding the necessary directories to the exclusions list, the app launches successfully.

**Problems Identified:**

* Default Windows installation method (AppInstaller) doesn't work.
* Downloaded EXE doesn't start due to Windows Defender blockage.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Update AppInstaller and Microsoft Store app.
* Check Windows Defender settings for blocked apps and exclusions.
* Add necessary directories to Windows Defender exclusions.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* User successfully launches the app after resolving Windows Defender issue.
* Further investigation needed to determine why Windows Defender blocks the app and if it's a recurring issue.
* Potential documentation updates planned for Windows installation and troubleshooting processes.

**Additional Notes:**

* This conversation provides valuable insights for improving the Pieces app installation process on Windows.
* User feedback highlights the importance of considering Windows Defender compatibility in app development.
* Documentation updates will likely be implemented in February 2025.
